animationSpeedLimitReached.value: Animation speed limit reached! Current animation speed reduced to {{percent}}% normal.

label.value: Add focused tool to construction area

labelInnerContent.value: Press Space or Enter to drop the selected component into the circuit.
Press Space or Enter to begin connecting from the focused junction.
Use arrow keys to move grabbed junction to different attachment choices.
Press Space or Enter again to complete the connection, or to detach.

emptyConstructionAreaMessage.value: Add Circuit Components as needed. Once added, open connection point options or open component edit panel with Space or Enter. Connected components auto-organize into groups. Remove a selected component or disconnect a selected connection point with Delete key. Check out Keyboard Shortcuts for more details on editing and connecting components.

unconnectedSummary.value:
{ $count ->
  [one] 1 unconnected circuit component. { $componentList }.
  *[other] { $count } unconnected circuit components. { $componentList }.
}

connectionStatus.value:
{ $allConnected ->
  [true] All connection points connected.
  *[false] Some connection points not connected.
}

currentFlowStatus.value:
{ $flowLevel ->
  [all] Current is flowing through all circuit components.
  [some] Current is flowing through some circuit components.
  [none] Current is not flowing.
  *[notShown] Current is not shown.
}

playArea.value: A Construction Area creates a building space for components added from a Circuit Components toolbox. Build and navigate your circuits there. A Voltmeter and Ammeter can be found in the Measurement Tools toolbox. Display Options provide ways to add and remove visual information from components in the Construction Area.

controlArea.value: There's an option to choose between a Lifelike View or a Schematic View for any components and circuits, and you can Reset All to clear everything and start over.

currentDetails.value:
{ $componentCount ->
  [zero] Currently, Construction Area has no circuit components. Several { $viewType } components are available in Circuit Components carousel.
  *[other] Currently, Construction Area has { $componentCount } circuit components{ $connectivityPhrase } { $currentFlowingPhrase } Several { $viewType } components are available in Circuit Components carousel.
}

connectivityPhrase.value:
{ $disconnectedCount ->
  [zero] { $groupCount ->
           [zero] .
           [one] , connected in 1 group.
           *[other] , connected in { $groupCountNumber } separate groups.
         }
  [one] { $groupCount ->
          [zero] . One is disconnected.
          [one] . One is disconnected. The remaining { $connectedCount } are connected in 1 group.
          *[other] . One is disconnected. The remaining { $connectedCount } are connected in { $groupCountNumber } separate groups.
        }
  *[other] { $groupCount ->
             [zero] . { $disconnectedCountNumber } are disconnected.
             [one] . { $disconnectedCountNumber } are disconnected. The remaining { $connectedCount } are connected in 1 group.
             *[other] . { $disconnectedCountNumber } are disconnected. The remaining { $connectedCount } are connected in { $groupCountNumber } separate groups.
           }
}

currentFlowingPhrase.value:
{ $hasCurrentFlowing ->
  [flowing] Current is flowing in { $groupsWithCurrent } of { $groupCountNumber } groups.
  *[notFlowing] There is no current flowing.
}

interactionHint.value: Add circuit components and start connecting. Be sure to add at least one Wire.

leadingCircuitActive.value:
{ $currentLevel ->
  [low] In circuit, electrons flow slowly. Circuit has:
  [medium] In circuit, electrons flow at medium speed. Circuit has:
  *[high] In circuit, electrons flow quickly. Circuit has:
}

additionalComponentCount.value:
{ $count ->
  [one] { $count } additional circuit component
 *[other] { $count } additional circuit components
}

helpTextCase1.value: Add Circuit Components. You need a wire and at least 2 additional components to build a circuit. Check out Keyboard Shortcuts for more details.

helpTextCase2.value: Look for leads and terminals on any component and hit Space to pop up options for making a junction. Disconnect junctions or remove components with Delete key. Check out Keyboard Shortcuts for more details.

helpTextCase3.value: Look for components and hit Space to pop up options for editing. Remove selected component with Delete key. Check out Keyboard Shortcuts for more details.

editPanelHelpText.value: Use available controls to change, disconnect or remove selected { $componentType }.

junctionSplit.value:
{ $connectionCount ->
  [one] { $junctionName } split into one new connection.
  *[other] { $junctionName } split into { $connectionCount } new connections.
}

lightBulbState.value:
{ $state ->
  [off] { $componentName } is now off.
  [dim] { $componentName } glows dimly.
  [steady] { $componentName } glows steadily.
  *[bright] { $componentName } shines brightly.
}

componentValueChange.value:
{ $type ->
  [battery] { $componentName } voltage changed from { $oldValue } to { $newValue } volts.
  [resistor] { $componentName } resistance changed from { $oldValue } to { $newValue } ohms.
  *[lightBulb] { $componentName } resistance changed from { $oldValue } to { $newValue } ohms.
}

currentChangePhrase.value:
{ $scope ->
  [some] { $direction ->
           [changed] Current through some Group { $groupIndex } circuit elements changed.
           [increased] Current through some Group { $groupIndex } circuit elements increased.
           [decreased] Current through some Group { $groupIndex } circuit elements decreased.
           [stopped] Current through some Group { $groupIndex } circuit elements stopped.
           *[reversed] Current through some Group { $groupIndex } circuit elements reversed.
         }
  *[all] { $direction ->
           [changed] Current through all Group { $groupIndex } circuit elements changed.
           [increased] Current through all Group { $groupIndex } circuit elements increased.
           [decreased] Current through all Group { $groupIndex } circuit elements decreased.
           [stopped] Current through Group { $groupIndex } stopped.
           *[reversed] Current through all Group { $groupIndex } circuit elements reversed.
         }
}

lightBulbChangePhrase.value:
{ $scope ->
  [some] { $direction ->
           [brighter] Some Group { $groupIndex } light bulbs got brighter.
           [dimmer] Some Group { $groupIndex } light bulbs got dimmer.
           *[changed] Some Group { $groupIndex } light bulbs changed brightness.
         }
  *[all] { $direction ->
           [brighter] All Group { $groupIndex } light bulbs got brighter.
           [dimmer] All Group { $groupIndex } light bulbs got dimmer.
           *[changed] All Group { $groupIndex } light bulbs changed brightness.
         }
}

accessibleHelpText.value: Look for components in carousel and add them to Construction Area. Once added, return to  Construction Area and look for components and their connection points to edit or choose options  for connecting.

accessibleContextResponseChecked.value: Real light bulbs added to circuit component toolbox.

accessibleContextResponseUnchecked.value: Real light bulbs removed from circuit component toolbox.

accessibleContextResponseChecked.value:
{ $currentType ->
  [electrons] Electron flow shown in circuit.
  *[conventional] Conventional current arrows shown in circuit.
}

accessibleContextResponseUnchecked.value:
{ $currentType ->
  [electrons] Electron flow hidden in circuit.
  *[conventional] Conventional current arrows hidden in circuit.
}

accessibleContextResponse.value: Current animation shows electrons moving through the circuit.
Current animation shows conventional current arrows.

accessibleContextResponseChecked.value: Circuit component values shown on each component.

accessibleContextResponseUnchecked.value: Circuit component values hidden on circuit components.

accessibleHelpText.value: Select the view type for circuit components.
Show the circuit components like they would look in real life.

accessibleContextResponse.value: Circuit components displayed with lifelike appearance.

accessibleHelpText.value: Show the circuit components like they would look in a schematic circuit diagram.

accessibleContextResponse.value: Circuit components displayed with schematic symbols.

accessibleHelpText.value: Drag this tool to the circuit to create a new { $accessibleName }.
